result.execSummary:
The defendant Demario Leshawn Steward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend GreatBod. Harm [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges including DNA.  All applicable fees of supervision.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS ORDERED:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

***ORDER AMENDING JOC dated December 19, 2014, Judge Witkowiak/defendant IS NOT eligible for the CIP or the WSAP programs.***
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.   Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is advised:  he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also advised he is  unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored; and if he  is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (20 pages) commencing SENTENCING HEARING SEPTEMBER 26, 2014 received and filed.CB
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.   jbs
Letter from DOC seeking amended judgment of conviction regarding WSAP & CIP eligibility.

Defendant Demario Leshawn Steward in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Demario Leshawn Steward in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Shandalaya C.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 154 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Earned Release program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $870.00 payable to Shandalaya C; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armou. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his/her civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Letter in Support of the Defendant
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Written Explanation of Deteminate Sentence
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Victim Impact Statement received and filed.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Demario Leshawn Steward not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for sentencing hearing, however defendant was not produced due to jail computer systems being down.  Case adjourned for sentencing  in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
FILED.
FILED.

Defendant Demario Leshawn Steward in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Demario Leshawn Steward in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
-  AMENDED INFORMATION FILE.
COUNT 1 AMENDED to Aggravated Batter, contrary to 940.19(5), 939.50(3)(e), Wisconsin Stats a CLASS E FELONY.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1,Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was NOT ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-22-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Demario Leshawn Steward not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, defense counsel requests adjournment of Plea Hearing.  With the agreement of all parties, Plea Hearing scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Plea Hearing scheduled for 07-09-2014 at 08:30am.

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Demario Leshawn Steward not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-06-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demario Leshawn Steward in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Demario Leshawn Steward in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for Thomas Potter for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shandalaya C.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Demario Leshawn Steward in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Demario Leshawn Steward in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
